headerInstruction.text: For patients with pain from chronic diseases or conditions such as cancer, osteoarthritis and low back pain, or with pain from acute conditions such as postoperative pain

question.questionText: Throughout our lives, most of us have had pain from time to time (such as minor headaches, sprains and toothaches). Have you had pain other than these everyday kinds of pain today?

dataElement.longName: Brief Pain Inventory Short Form Questionnaire 1 Have Pain Other Than Everyday Kind of Pain Indicator
dataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of whether or not pain, other than everyday kinds of pain such as minor headaches, sprains, and toothaches, is being experienced today, using a yes or no response.

valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.
The affirmative response to a question.

referenceDocument.name: BPI SF
referenceDocument.doctext: Throughout our lives, most of us have had pain from time to time (such as minor headaches, sprains and toothaches). Have you had pain other than these everyday kinds of pain today? (1)

referenceDocument.name: BPI User's Guide
referenceDocument.doctext: Documentation of the BPI's development and psychometric properties.

referenceDocument.name: Throughout our lives, most of
referenceDocument.doctext: Throughout our lives, most of us have had pain from time to time (such as minor headaches, sprains and toothaches). Have you had pain other than these everyday kinds of pain today?

referenceDocument.name: Question Instruction
referenceDocument.doctext: Throughout our lives, most of us have had pain from time to time (such as minor headaches, sprains and toothaches).

referenceDocument.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
referenceDocument.doctext: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.

validValue.description: The non-affirmative response to a question.
The affirmative response to a question.

question.questionText: On the diagram, shade in the areas where you feel pain. Put an X on the area that hurts the most.

dataElement.longName: Brief Pain Inventory Short Form Questionnaire 2 Feel Pain Diagram Area Shading and Hurts Most Mark Text
dataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of where pain is felt, using a diagram of the body to mark the area that hurts the most.

referenceDocument.name: On the diagram, shade in the
referenceDocument.doctext: On the diagram, shade in the areas where you feel pain. Put an X on the area that hurts the most.

referenceDocument.name: BPI SF
referenceDocument.doctext: On the diagram, shade in the areas where you feel pain. Put an X on the area that hurts the most. (2)

referenceDocument.name: BPI User's Guide
referenceDocument.doctext: Documentation of the BPI's development and psychometric properties.

referenceDocument.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
referenceDocument.doctext: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.

question.questionText: Please rate your pain by circling the one number that best describes your pain at its WORST in the last 24 hours.

dataElement.longName: Brief Pain Inventory Short Form Questionnaire 3 Last 24 Hours Pain at its Worst Score 11 Point Likert Scale
dataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation rating pain at its worst in the last 24 hours, using a 11 point Likert scale.

valueDomain.longName: BPI Pain Rating Score 11 Point Likert Scale

valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective score of 10 on a scale that ranges from 0: No Pain to 10: Pain As Bad As You Can Imagine.
A subjective score of 9 on a scale that ranges from 0: No Pain to 10: Pain As Bad As You Can Imagine.
A subjective score of 8 on a scale that ranges from 0: No Pain to 10: Pain As Bad As You Can Imagine.
A subjective score of 7 on a scale that ranges from 0: No Pain to 10: Pain As Bad As You Can Imagine.
A subjective score of 6 on a scale that ranges from 0: No Pain to 10: Pain As Bad As You Can Imagine.
A subjective score of 5 on a scale that ranges from 0: No Pain to 10: Pain As Bad As You Can Imagine.
A subjective score of 4 on a scale that ranges from 0: No Pain to 10: Pain As Bad As You Can Imagine.
A subjective score of 3 on a scale that ranges from 0: No Pain to 10: Pain As Bad As You Can Imagine.
A subjective score of 2 on a scale that ranges from 0: No Pain to 10: Pain As Bad As You Can Imagine.
A subjective score of 1 on a scale that ranges from 0: No Pain to 10: Pain As Bad As You Can Imagine.
A subjective score of 0 on a scale that ranges from 0: No Pain to 10: Pain As Bad As You Can Imagine.

question.questionText: What treatments or medications are you receiving for your pain?

dataElement.longName: Brief Pain Inventory Short Form Questionnaire 7 Treatment or Medication Receiving for Pain Descriptive Text
dataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation that describes treatment or medication name currently being received for pain.

referenceDocument.name: BPI User's Guide
referenceDocument.doctext: Documentation of the BPI's development and psychometric properties.

question.questionText: In the last 24 hours, how much relief have pain treatments or medications provided? Please circle the one percentage that shows how much RELIEF you have received.

dataElement.longName: Brief Pain Inventory Short Form Questionnaire 8 Last 24 Hours How Much Relief Received from Treatment or Medication Score 11 Point Percent Likert Scale
dataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how much relief pain treatment or medication has provided in the last 24 hours, using a 11 point Likert scale.

valueDomain.longName: BPI Percentage Relief From Pain Treatment or Medication Score 11 Point Likert Scale

valueMeaning.longName: Percentage Relief From Pain Treatment or Medication Score 0
valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective score of 0% on a scale that ranges from 0%: No Relief to 100%: Complete Relief.

valueMeaning.longName: Percentage Relief From Pain Treatment or Medication Score 10
valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective score of 0% on a scale that ranges from 0%: No Relief to 100%: Complete Relief.

valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective score of 100% on a scale that ranges from 0%: No Relief to 100%: Complete Relief.

valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective score of 40% on a scale that ranges from 0%: No Relief to 100%: Complete Relief.

valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective score of 60% on a scale that ranges from 0%: No Relief to 100%: Complete Relief.

valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective score of 80% on a scale that ranges from 0%: No Relief to 100%: Complete Relief.

valueMeaning.longName: Percentage Relief From Pain Treatment or Medication Score 90
valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective score of 90% on a scale that ranges from 0%: No Relief to 100%: Complete Relief.

instruction.text: General Question #9A of 9 Circle the one number that describes how, during the past 24 hours, pain has interefered with your:

dataElement.longName: Brief Pain Inventory Short Form Questionnaire 9A Last 24 Hours Pain Interfered with General Activity Score 11 Point Likert Scale
dataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how much pain has interfered with general activity in the last 24 hours, using a 11 point Likert scale.

valueDomain.longName: BPI Pain Interference Score 11 Point Likert Scale

valueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective score of 0 on a scale that ranges from 0: Does Not Interfere to 10: Completely Interferes.
